Assess the behavior of the expression as a and/or b approaches extreme values (approaching 0 or infinity) to ensure that the critical values found are indeed global minimums.
Verify the solution by plugging the values of a and b back into the original equation to confirm the minimum value.

Compare the minimum value obtained with any notable specific cases (e.g., \(a = b\)) to ensure it is indeed the minimum.
Conclude with the smallest value obtained for \((a^2+b^2)/(a+b)^2\) over all positive \(a\) and \(b\).

Recognize the expression as a function of two variables: f(a, b) = (a^2 + b^2) / (a+b)^2.
Consider whether simplifying the function by introducing a substitution can aid in minimizing the expression.
Evaluate the behavior of the function as a and b approach zero or become very large.

Solve the system of equations derived from setting the partial derivatives to zero to find candidate points for minima.

Assess the value of the function at the critical points and compare it with values at the boundary of the domain (if applicable).
Determine the smallest value of the function among the calculated candidate points and special cases identified through boundary behavior.
